channel.title: Workshop on Guts of Git
channel.description: Recent content in Workshop on Guts of Git

item.title: Preamble
item.description: Why Do We Use Git? (Or any VCS?) # Git is a tool we use. Before we even start diving into how it works we should understand what exactly it provides and why we use it Just for code backup? # If that’s what you want. Just use ‘cp’ - It’s faster, lighter, and simpler Just to share code? # Again there are plenty of ways to share files without Git:

item.title: Git Fundamentals
item.description: Fundamentals # Let’s get started already! This page will walk you step by step through some very basic git commands. While the commands themselves may not be anything new or special to you, we will be diving into the guts of git and what each command is actually doing inside the repo. Next Creating a New Repository # It’s time to start by making an empty Git repository. We do this by making a directory, changing into it, and using git init
